Instance.description: A trait is a defining characteristic of a Sim. Traits affect a Sim's behavior, either by unlocking new choices for them to make as well as modifying the way they do things. Traits come in different varieties. Some are visible and picked by the player; other are awarded for accomplishing certain aspirations; and others are hidden and assigned by the game.

TunableList.name: actor_mixers
TunableList.description: Mixers this adds to an associated actor object. (When targeting something else.)

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The super affordance these mixers are associated with.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: Set of mixer affordances associated with the super affordance.

Tunable.description: Linked mixer affordance.

TunableList.name: ages
TunableList.description: The allowed ages for this trait. If no ages are specified, then all ages are considered valid.

Tunable.name: allow_from_gallery
Tunable.description: If checked, then this trait is allowed to be transferred over from Sims downloaded from the gallery.

TunableList.name: always_on_buffs
TunableList.description: Buffs that should always remain on the Sim when this trait is on the Sim. Buffs tuned in this list are unaffected by the 'Add On Spawn Only' toggle and will not be removed when the Sim travels.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

Tunable.name: always_send_test_event_on_add
Tunable.display: Always Send Test Event On Add
Tunable.description: If checked, will send out a test event when added to a trait tracker even if the receiving sim is hidden or not instanced.

TunableList.name: animation_overlays
TunableList.description: A list of animation overlays to play on the Sim this trait is attached to. They are added when this trait is added, and removed when it is removed.

TunableTuple.description: A construct that is responsible for playing overlay animations on a Sim.

Tunable.name: _overlay_animation
Tunable.description: The animation element controlling the overlay.

TunableList.name: bb_filter_styles
TunableList.description: If this trait is used to filter the BB catalog, these styles will be applied to the filter.

Tunable.description: The style to use as a filter.

TunableEnum.description: If this trait is used to filter the BB catalog, these tags will be used to apply the filter.

TunableList.name: buff_replacements
TunableList.description: A mapping of buff replacement. If Sim has this trait on, whenever he get the buff tuned in the key of the mapping, it will get replaced by the value of the mapping.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: Buff that will get replaced to apply on Sim by this trait.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Data specific to this buff replacement.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the buff reason.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The overridden buff reason.

TunableEnum.name: buff_replacement_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of this buff replacement, relative to other replacements. Tune this to be a higher value if you want this replacement to take precedence. e.g. (NORMAL) trait_HatesChildren (buff_FirstTrimester -> buff_FirstTrimester_HatesChildren) (HIGH) trait_Male (buff_FirstTrimester -> buff_FirstTrimester_Male) In this case, both traits have overrides on the pregnancy buffs. However, we don't want males impregnated by aliens that happen to hate children to lose their alien-specific buffs. Therefore we tune the male replacement at a higher priority.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff used to replace the buff tuned as key.

TunableList.name: buffs
TunableList.description: Buffs that should be added to the Sim whenever this trait is equipped.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

Tunable.name: buffs_add_on_spawn_only
Tunable.description: If unchecked, buffs are added to the Sim as soon as this trait is added. If checked, buffs will be added only when the Sim is instantiated and removed when the Sim uninstantiates. General guidelines: If the buffs only matter to Sims, for example buffs that alter autonomy behavior or walkstyle, this should be checked.

TunableList.name: buffs_proximity
TunableList.description: Proximity buffs that are active when this trait is equipped.

TunableVariant.name: build_buy_purchase_tracking
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows this trait to track various build-buy purchases via event listening in the trait tracker.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Loots to apply to the hamper when clothing pile is being put.

Tunable.name: can_die
Tunable.description: When set, Sims with this trait are allowed to die. When unset, Sims are prevented from dying.

TunableEnum.name: cas_allowed_pack
TunableEnum.description: Will only be allowed for the specified pack,

Tunable.name: cas_idle_asm_key
Tunable.description: The ASM to use for the CAS idle.

Tunable.name: cas_idle_asm_state
Tunable.description: The state to play for the CAS idle.

Tunable.name: cas_selected_icon
Tunable.description: Icon to be displayed in CAS when this trait has already been applied to a Sim. Currently used by Walk Styles.

Tunable.name: cas_trait_asm_param
Tunable.description: The ASM parameter for this trait for use with CAS ASM state machine, driven by selection of this Trait, i.e. when a player selects the a romantic trait, the Flirty ASM is given to the state machine to play. The name tuned here must match the animation state name parameter expected in Swing.

Tunable.name: cas_trait_hidden
Tunable.description: If unchecked, trait is hidden upon entering CAS. If checked, trait will appear as normal within CAS. Current Usage: Hiding temporary ghost types within CAS

Tunable.name: cas_trait_vfx
Tunable.description: The VFX File Name of the effect that we want to play when the trait is selected. i.e. Death By Electricity Trait -> ghost_death_by_electricity

TunableList.name: conditional_commodities
TunableList.description: List of commodities that are conditionally added to a sim, if the sim has this trait. If a given commodity is also blacklisted by another trait that the sim also has, it will NOT be added. There are no test event listeners on these conditional commodities, instead, the evaluation of the tests will run on load and when a trait with conditional commodities is added/removed.

TunableTuple.description: Tuple of the commodity and its corresponding test set.

Tunable.name: delay
Tunable.description: If checked then this commodity will not be tested for addition until after all sims and households have been loaded. This may be needed for some tests such as Region which is set after traits have been loaded. Use cautiously, as other stuff being loaded won't be able to successfully test against this commodity (or anything added by this commodity) during the load process. Note: Testing against other loaded traits themselves does NOT need delay checked. Testing against buffs or commodities (or stuff added by same) added by traits WILL need delay checked. Testing against other delayed conditional commodities (or stuff added by same) is 'Don't do that'. Test against the trait and what the conditional commodities/stuff added by them test for if needed.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass to add the commodity.

TunableList.name: conflicting_traits
TunableList.description: Conflicting traits for this trait. If the Sim has any of the specified traits, then they are not allowed to be equipped with this one. e.g. Family Oriented conflicts with Hates Children, and vice-versa.

TunableVariant.name: culling_behavior
TunableVariant.description: The culling behavior of a Sim with this trait.

TunableTuple.name: default_behavior
TunableTuple.description: Default sim culling behavior.

TunableTuple.name: immune_to_culling
TunableTuple.description: When set, Sims are immune from being culled via the story progression action that culls our sim population to stay under cap. E.g. Grim Reaper, Alien Pollinator. These are the only sims in the game that explicitly do not age up or die.

TunableTuple.name: importance_as_npc_score
TunableTuple.description: When set, Sims use an additional culling immunity score to determine how important it is to keep them from being culled.

Tunable.name: additional_culling_immunity
Tunable.description: This number will be a boost a Sims importance when the culling system scores this Sim. Higher the number, lower the probability of this Sim being culled.

TunableVariant.name: day_night_tracking
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows this trait to track various aspects of day and night via buffs on the owning Sim. For example, if this is enabled and the Sunlight Buff is tuned with buffs, the Sim will get the buffs added every time they're in sunlight and removed when they're no longer in sunlight.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tracks the day/night status for whoever has this trait by applying buffs based on the tuning.

TunableList.name: day_buffs
TunableList.description: Allows a list of buffs to be added to the owning Sim when it's currently day time in the region (based on Sunrise and Sunset time tuning for the Region). These buffs are also guaranteed to be removed from the Sim when it's no longer day time, regardless of where the buff was applied. For instance, if an interaction has a basic extra that also applied a buff in this list, but the Sim is given this trait and it's not day time. That buff will be removed. Do not rely on Day Buffs and Night Buffs to be perfectly mutually exclusive. It's possible, due to timing issues, that both Day Buffs and Night Buffs can be on the Sim at the same time, or neither on the Sim, for a brief amount of time. If you need buff exclusivity, use the tuning on buffs.

TunableTuple.description: The buff to be added to the owning Sim when it's day time.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableList.name: force_refresh_buffs
TunableList.description: This is the list of buffs, which upon removal, refreshes the status of day-night-sunlight buffs. This is needed because when the vampire resistance cocktail buff expires, we have no good way of adding the burnt-by-sun buff automatically. Any buff which should refresh the day-night-sunlight buff should be added to this list.

TunableList.name: shade_buffs
TunableList.description: Allows a list of buffs to be added to the owning Sim when they're not in the sunlight. These buffs are also guaranteed to be removed from the Sim when they're no longer in the shade, regardless of where the buff was applied. For instance, if an interaction has a basic extra that also applied a buff in this list, but the Sim is given this trait and they're not in the shade. That buff will be removed. Do not rely on Sunlight Buffs and Shade Buffs to be perfectly mutually exclusive. It's possible, due to timing issues, that both Sunlight Buffs and Shade Buffs can be on the Sim at the same time, or neither on the Sim, for a brief amount of time. If you need buff exclusivity, use the tuning on buffs.

These buffs are also guaranteed to be removed from the Sim when they're no longer in sunlight, regardless of where the buff was applied. For instance, if an interaction has a basic extra that also applied a buff in this list, but the Sim is given this trait and they're not in the sunlight. That buff will be removed. Do not rely on Sunlight Buffs and Shade Buffs to be perfectly mutually exclusive. It's possible, due to timing issues, that both buffs in Sunlight Buffs and buffs in Shade buffs can be on the sim at the same time, or neither on the sim, for a brief amount of time. If you need buff exclusivity, use the tuning on buffs.

TunableVariant.name: disable_aging
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, aging out of specific ages can be disabled.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The tuning that disables aging out of specific age groups.

TunableList.name: allowed_ages
TunableList.description: A list of ages that the Sim CAN age out of. If an age is in this list then the Sim is allowed to age out of it. If an age is not in this list than a Sim is not allowed to age out of it. For example, if the list only contains Child and Teen, then a Child Sim would be able to age up to Teen and a Teen Sim would be able to age up to Young Adult. But, a Young Adult, Adult, or Elder Sim would not be able to age up.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, this tooltip will be displayed in the aging progress bar when aging is disabled because of the trait.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The string that displays in the aging UI when aging up is disabled due to the trait.

Tunable.name: disallow_from_decorator_gigs
Tunable.description: If checked, disallow using this trait in decorator gigs.

Tunable.name: display_name
Tunable.description: The trait's display name. This string is provided with the owning Sim as its only token.

Tunable.name: display_name_gender_neutral
Tunable.description: The trait's gender-neutral display name. This string is not provided any tokens, and thus can't rely on context to properly form masculine and feminine forms. Currently only used by Clubs and Death reasons in Family Tree.

TunableList.name: display_overrides
TunableList.description: This provides appearance overrides to traits based on other details of a sim such as Age, Occult, or Traits. Appearance overrides are applied in CAS and regular Gameplay. They are not applied in other contexts such as the website. Note: an Icon is required for applying the override.

Tunable.name: display_name_override
Tunable.description: The trait's display name. This string is provided with the owning Sim as its only token.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: The trait's icon.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: The list of criteria the sim must match before this override is accepted.

TunableTuple.name: age
TunableTuple.description: Test the current sim's age.

TunableList.name: ages
TunableList.description: The list of ages to match.

TunableTuple.name: occult_type
TunableTuple.description: Test the current sim's occult type. The sim must possess all occult types to match.

TunableList.name: occult_types
TunableList.description: The list of occult types to match.

TunableTuple.name: traits
TunableTuple.description: Test a list of traits the sim must have. The sim must possess all traits to match.

TunableList.name: traits
TunableList.description: The list of traits to match.

Tunable.name: pie_menu_icon
Tunable.description: The trait's pie menu icon.

Tunable.name: trait_description
Tunable.description: The trait's description.

Tunable.name: trait_origin_description
Tunable.description: A description of how the Sim obtained this trait. Can be overloaded for other uses in certain cases: - When the trait type is AGENT this string is the name of the agency's Trade type and will be provided with the owning sim as its token. - When the trait type is HIDDEN and the trait is used by the CAS STORIES flow, this can be used as a secondary description in the CAS Stories UI. If this trait is tagged as a CAREER CAS stories trait, this description will be used to explain which skills are also granted with this career.

TunableVariant.name: entitlement
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this trait is locked by an entitlement. Otherwise, this trait is available to all players.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Entitlement required to get this trait.

TunableList.name: event_test_based_loots
TunableList.description: A list of tests that are connected to events and loots to play when those tests pass. These will only be tested for non-NPC Sims.

Tunable.name: loot
Tunable.description: The loot to apply when the events pass.

TunableVariant.name: test
TunableVariant.description: A test event that is linked to giving the loot.

TunableTuple.name: at_work
TunableTuple.description: Tests if the subject is currently at work.

TunableVariant.name: active_work_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, if this is set the test will only pass if the Sim is at an active event. If not set, the test will instead only pass if the Sim is not at an active event.

Tunable.name: is_at_work
Tunable.description: Check to return True if any of the subjects are at work.

TunableTuple.name: bucks_perk_unlocked
TunableTuple.description: A test for which kind of bucks perk is being unlocked

Tunable.name: bucks_perk
Tunable.description: The specific Perk to check against.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, the results of the test will be inverted. The truth table is as follows for sim with the perk: test_if_unlocked is true and invert is false: True test_if_unlocked is true and invert is true: False test_if_unlocked is false and invert is false: False test_if_unlocked is false and invert is true: True

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose household will be checked for the specified Perk If being used outside of an interaction, any Sim participant types are not valid. Consider using object in these circumstances.

TunableVariant.name: requires_same_club
TunableVariant.description: When enabled it requires that the tuned target be in the associated club with the participant. For example, this can be used to require that the participant and target be in the club associated with the secret handshake interaction and that the correct perk for that handshake is unlocked.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant that must also have the perk unlocked in a bucks tracker that they share in common with the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: test_if_unlocked
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will check to see if the specified Perk is unlocked. If unchecked, this test will check to see if the specified Perk is locked.

TunableTuple.name: buff_added
TunableTuple.description: A factory that tests whether a specified buff or buffs are given to a sim.

TunableList.name: acceptable_buffs
TunableList.description: Buffs that will pass the test.

Tunable.name: check_visibility
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check to make sure that the buff is visible.

TunableTuple.name: career_promoted
TunableTuple.description: Tunable test that checks a career that was promoted against whitelist/blacklist tuning.

TunableTuple.name: event_origin_careers
TunableTuple.description: The goal test will only pass for career events originating from careers validated against the whitelist/blacklist.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

Tunable.description: Allowed and Disallowed Careers.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify

TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison

Tunable.name: negate

TunableVariant.TunableTuple:
<TunableVariant type="None" name="user_level" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="User Level" description="Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level. The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass. min <= current career level <= max." group="General">

Tunable.description: Sims that doesn't fit with required relation bits will be consider as valid even if they are not in track value threshold Sim doesn't have Relation Bit => Don't care about the score => VALID Sim have Relation Bit => Check Score => Score in Threshold => VALID

TunableEnum.name: counting_method
TunableEnum.description: Specify what we're checking the collection threshold of. COLLECTION: Count number of collectables collected - specified by Collection Type (either a particular collection, or all collections) - specified by Specific Items or Specific Targeting (the collections of those items) DEFINITION: Check whether a definition id has been collected or not - specified by Specific Items or Specific Targeting LEGACY: Choose counting method automatically (not recommended). DEFINITION will be preferred when possible over COLLECTION.

Tunable.name: fail_if_potentially_invalid
Tunable.description: Setting to True will cause this test to fail if any provided definition has any Collected Invalid States (from objects.collection_manager) tuned.

Tunable.name: incomplete_collection

TunableTuple.name: festival_running
TunableTuple.description: This is a test that triggers when the festival begins.

TunableVariant.name: check_if_on_festival_street
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test against if the player is on the festival's street.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will pass only if the player is on the festival's street. If unchecked, the test will pass only if the player is not on the festival street.

TunableVariant.name: drama_node
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check a specific type of festival drama node otherwise we will look at all of the festival drama nodes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reference to the festival drama node that we want to be running.

TunableVariant.name: festivals_to_check
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will only check a subset of all festival drama nodes referenced here. This will only apply if there is no specific drama node specified.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of festival drama nodes that we want to check against.

Tunable.description: Reference to the festival drama node that we want to check against.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled this test will pass if no festivals of the tuned requirements are running.

TunableTuple.name: valid_time_blocks
TunableTuple.description: Festival drama nodes have a tunable pre-festival duration that delay festival start to some point after the drama node has started. For example, if the festival drama node has a pre-festival duration of 2 hours and the drama node runs at 8am, the festival will not start until 10am. By default, this test passes if the festival drama node is running, regardless if the festival is in its pre-festival duration. This tuning changes that behavior.

Tunable.name: pre_festival
Tunable.description: If the festival is currently in its pre-festival duration, test can pass if this is checked and fails if unchecked.

Tunable.name: running
Tunable.description: If the festival is running (it is past its pre-festival duration), test can pass if this is checked and fails if unchecked.

TunableTuple.name: generation_created
TunableTuple.description: A test that determines if a player has completed some sort of Legacy Challenge. This allows the combination of two tests: whether or not any household has been played for a certain number of generations, and whether or not there is a specific number of households that have been played for a certain number of generations. Please note: this does not take into account households that are no longer in the world. This test can only operate on the current state of the game. This test is triggered upon either giving birth or adoption a Sim.

TunableTuple.name: generation_threshold
TunableTuple.description: A household is considered only if at least one Sim in it satisfies this threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: household_threshold
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, then this test must pass for the specified number of households. If disabled, then this test must pass for the active household only.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Require a certain number of households to have at least one Sim satisfying 'generation_threshold'.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: has_buff
TunableTuple.description: Test whether or not a participant has or doesn't have specific buffs.

Tunable.name: apply_whitelist_on_individual_basis
Tunable.description: If checked, will require that each target has at least one whitelisted buff. If unchecked, will require only a single target to have at least one whitelisted buff.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: The Sim must not have any buff in this list to pass the test.

TunableEnum.description: The Sim must not have any buff that matches any of these tags to pass the test.

TunableList.name: categories_to_ignore
TunableList.description: If a buff is found from Require Categories or Disallow Categories and has a category from within this list, then it will be ignored for the test and not count toward passing or failing.

TunableEnum.description: Category if found on a buff to make the buff be ignored.

TunableList.name: disallow_categories
TunableList.description: Each target must not have any buffs with any of the categories tuned here. This category comes from the buff's owning commodity categories (from Categories tuned on the commodity or from Temporary Commodity Info on the buff). Buffs with any category tuned in Categories To Ignore will not be considered in this test.

TunableEnum.description: Category to be disallowed.

TunableList.name: require_categories
TunableList.description: Each target must have at least one buff with at least one of the categories tuned here. This category comes from the buff's owning commodity categories (from Categories tuned on the commodity or from Temporary Commodity Info on the buff). Buffs with any category tuned in Categories To Ignore will not be considered in this test.

TunableEnum.description: Category to be required.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, participant will test for buff's on the whitelist.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: The participant must have at least one buff in this list to pass the test.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, participant will test for buffs which match tags in the defined set.

TunableEnum.description: The participant must have at least one buff which matches a tag in this list to pass the test.

TunableTuple.name: household_size
TunableTuple.description: Require the specified participant's household to have a specified number of free Sim slots.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of test to

TunableTuple.name: actual_size
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing the actual number of sims in a household. This should not be used for testing if you are able to add a sim to the household and should only be used for functionality that depents on the actual household members being there and not counting reserved slots. ex. Achievement for having a household of 8 sims.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: The number of household members.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing for a specific number of free slots in the household.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: The number of required free slots for the specified household.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing a specific Sim being added to the household.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose required slot count we consider.

TunableTuple.name: test_sim_infos
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing that a number of sims in a household pass some tuned test. ex. At least three sims in household are toddlers.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: The number of household members.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: test
TunableVariant.description: A test to apply to each sim in the household. If the test passes for a given sim, that will count toward the total.

TunableTuple.name: scenario_sim_status
TunableTuple.description: Test if a target sim is part of a scenario and/or has a certain scenario role.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, inverts the normal result of the test.

Tunable.name: role
Tunable.description: If tuned, we will test if the target sim has this role.

Tunable.name: scenario
Tunable.description: If tuned, we will test if the target sim is part of this scenario.

TunableTuple.name: sim_info
TunableTuple.description: The SimInfo tests some of the basic aspects of a Sim, such as their age, gender, or species.

TunableVariant.name: ages
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableVariant.name: can_age_up
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim is eligible to advance to the next age.

Tunable.name: specified
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim is eligible to advance to the next age.

TunableVariant.name: death_object_assigned
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim's death object (urnstone) has been assigned to it's tracker. This happens in the normal death flow, but is skipped from CAS or Gallery.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim's death object (urnstone) has been assigned to it's tracker. This happens in the normal death flow, but is skipped from CAS or Gallery.

TunableVariant.name: gender
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: specified
TunableEnum.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableVariant.name: has_been_played
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableVariant.name: is_active_sim
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableEnum.name: match_type
TunableEnum.description: When testing multiple participants if MATCH_ALL is set, then all the participants need to pass the test. If MATCH_ANY is set, test will pass as soon as one of them meet the criteria

TunableVariant.name: npc
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored. Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored. Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

TunableTuple.name: specified
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableTuple.name: specified_extended
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: has_object_passing_collection_tests
TunableTuple.description: Check if an object passes the specified Collection Tests.
Tests for a provided amount of a given collection type.

TunableEnum.name: collection_type
TunableEnum.description: The collection we are checking on. If collection type is unidentified then we will look through all collections.

Tunable.name: complete_collection
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will check for collection completed.

TunableEnum.name: counting_method
TunableEnum.description: Specify what we're checking the collection threshold of. COLLECTION: Count number of collectables collected - specified by Collection Type (either a particular collection, or all collections) - specified by Specific Items or Specific Targeting (the collections of those items) DEFINITION: Check whether a definition id has been collected or not - specified by Specific Items or Specific Targeting LEGACY: Choose counting method automatically (not recommended). DEFINITION will be preferred when possible over COLLECTION.

Tunable.name: fail_if_potentially_invalid
Tunable.description: Setting to True will cause this test to fail if any provided definition has any Collected Invalid States (from objects.collection_manager) tuned.

Tunable.name: incomplete_collection
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will check for collection incomplete.

TunableVariant.name: specific_items
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then the collection threshold test will check for specific items within the collection.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of allowed objects within a collection that we want to check.

Tunable.description: Object reference to each collectible object.

TunableVariant.name: specific_targeting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then the collection threshold test will check the provided target definitions within the collection.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Definition IDs or objects to apply collection test to.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: Threshold for the collection test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.description: The value of the threshold that the collection is compared against.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: get_total_count
Tunable.description: If disabled, we will stop searching the inventory as soon as we meet the required count, resulting in a partial count of the inventory. If enabled, we will search the entire inventory in order to get an accurate count of the inventory. Enable this option if you are interested in the total count of the inventory, such as during calculations.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_location
TunableVariant.description: Who owns the inventory. Either look in the inventory of a participant or specify an object inventory type directly. If participant returns multiple inventory owners, the test will pass only if ALL of those owners pass the inventory content test.

TunableEnum.name: inventory
TunableEnum.description: Check in the hidden inventory for objects that can go into the specified inventory type. EX: check that there are mailbox objects in the hidden inventory

TunableEnum.name: inventory
TunableEnum.description: Check the global Object inventory that has the specified type. EX: check in the global fridge inventory that exists for all fridges

TunableEnum.name: inventory
TunableEnum.description: The owner of the inventory

TunableTuple.name: required_count
TunableTuple.description: The inventory must have a tunable threshold of objects that pass the contents check test. EX: test is object definition of type pizza. required count is enabled and has a threshold of >= 5. That means this test will pass if you have 5 or more pizzas in your inventory. To check if any objects exist, use required count >= 1

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value

TunableEnum.name: test_hidden
TunableEnum.description: Optionally restrict to only hidden or non-hidden inventories.

Tunable.description: If this is true then it will negate the result of the test type. For instance if this is true and the test would return true for whether or not a sim has a particular career False will be returned instead.

TunableTuple.name: location_test
TunableTuple.description: Tests for object locations. Outside: Check if an object is on the inside or outside (has a roof over its head) Natural ground: Checks the floor tiles where the object is to see if it qualifies as natural ground

TunableVariant.name: has_terrain_tag
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject of the test is currently on the tuned terrain tag.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: , A set of terrain tags required for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will be inverted. In other words, the test will fail if at least one tag is detected at this location.

TunableList.name: terrain_tags
TunableList.description: A set of terrain tags. Only one of these tags needs to be present at this location. Although it is not tunable, there is a threshold weight underneath which a terrain tag will not appear to be present.

Tunable.name: test_floor_tiles
Tunable.description: If checked, floor tiles will be tested. Otherwise, it'll only check the terrain and will ignore the floor tiles on the terrain.

TunableVariant.name: in_common_area
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject is in the common area of an apartment. If unchecked will verify the subject is not.

TunableVariant.name: is_fire_allowed
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if fire is possible at the subject's position. If unchecked, will pass if fire is not possible. If not enabled, doesn't care either way.

TunableVariant.name: is_in_pond
TunableVariant.description: If checked, test if the subject is inside a pond. If unchecked, test if the subject is not inside a pond. If disabled, don't care either way.

TunableVariant.name: is_inside_building
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if the subject of the test is inside a building. This uses a client function that checks if the block the sim is mostly enclosed by walls or if not, if the adjoining blocks are themselves enclosed. This should be used when we want to test if a subject is inside a normally constructed building. If we simply want to test whether the subject is covered / has a roof over them, use is_outside. See comment on is_outside for more details. If unchecked, will negate this test.

TunableVariant.name: is_venue_type
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if the subject is at a venue of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Venue type required for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will return true if the subject IS NOT at a venue of the specified type.

Tunable.name: use_source_venue
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will test the source venue instead of the active venue. For example, the Community Lot instead of the active Marketplace. Testing the active venue is the default.

Tunable.name: venue_type
Tunable.description: Venue type to test against.

TunableVariant.name: valid_surface_types
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will test the surface type of the subject against prohibited or required surface types.

TunableTuple.name: Test_Surface_Types
TunableTuple.description: Required and Prohibited Surface Types.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Surface Type the object is placed on.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Surface Type the object is placed on.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: disallow
Tunable.description: If True, this test will pass if the Sim's mood does NOT match the tuned mood reference.

Tunable.name: mood
Tunable.description: The mood that must be active (or must be inactive, if 'Disallow' is checked).

TunableTuple.name: object_criteria
TunableTuple.description: A test to look at all the objects and compare them to the tuned criteria.

Tunable.name: completed
Tunable.description: If checked, any craftable object (such as a painting) must be finished for it to be considered.

TunableVariant.name: desired_state_threshold
TunableVariant.description: A state threshold that the object must satisfy for this test to pass

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A state threshold that the object must satisfy for this test to pass

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: identity_test
TunableVariant.description: Which test to run on the object in order to determine if it matches or not.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableVariant.name: in_use_test
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test whether the object is currently in use.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to tell if any of the tuned targets are in use by any sims.

TunableEnum.name: candidates
TunableEnum.description: Which sims will be considered users of the target.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If unchecked, this test will pass when the object is in use. If checked, this test will pass when the object is not in use. If a number using range is specified, then if checked the test will pass when the number using is outside the specified range. Either too many or too few.

TunableVariant.name: number_using
TunableVariant.description: An optional interval to specify an inclusive range of valid sims that must be using the target(s) Too few or too many, and the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableEnum.name: object_location
TunableEnum.description: The Location restriction for the object on active lot. Object needs to be in the set location space to pass the test.

Tunable.name: on_active_lot
Tunable.description: If checked, test whether or not the object is on the active lot. If unchecked the object can be either on the active lot or in the open streets area, we don't really care.

Tunable.name: owned
Tunable.description: If checked will test if the object is owned by the active household. If unchecked it doesn't matter who owns the object or if it is owned at all.

TunableVariant.name: positional_relationship_test

InteractionComplete: Triggers when the interaction ends. This is best used with a one shot interaction. It will not get called if an interaction is canceled. If you have a Sim parked in an interaction that you can only exit via cancel, you will not hit this. InteractionUpdate: Triggers on a 15 sim minute cadence from the start of the interaction. If the interaction ends before a cycle is up it does not trigger. Do not use this for short interactions as it has a possibility of never getting an update for an interaction.

Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: trait
TunableTuple.description: Test to require a Sim to have or not have certain specific traits.

Tunable.name: apply_thresholds_on_individual_basis
Tunable.description: If checked then Num Whitelist Required and Num Blacklist Allowed will be applied to each individual participant from the subject. If unchecked then it will apply the values to the total whitelist and blacklist matches on the group. IMPORTANT!!! In the case of objectives this should probably be set to false since we know that this is coming from only one sim and that we want to use the value that comes out of the test result numeric. This isn't just locked to being this value since there are valid cases within that system when you are looking at a group of sims and could want to test that one of your sims passes. Ex. Having a ghost sim in the household.

TunableList.name: blacklist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to not have traits of these types to pass this test. Should Num Blacklist Allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

TunableList.name: blacklist_traits
TunableList.description: The is required to not have traits from this list in order to pass this test. Should num_blacklist_allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

Tunable.description: A blacklist trait.

Tunable.name: num_blacklist_allowed
Tunable.description: The threshold of blacklist traits owned by the specified Sim that will trigger a test failure.

Tunable.name: num_whitelist_required
Tunable.description: The number of whitelist traits that the specified Sim is required to have in order to pass this test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableList.name: whitelist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits with these types in order to pass the test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_traits
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits from this list in order to pass the test.

Tunable.description: A whitelist trait. Please note: for pack-safe entries that are not loaded, the game will behave as if the entry doesn't exist. This allows you to specify a pack trait and required count of 1 and always fail the test should the appropriate pack not be installed.

TunableTuple.name: unlock_earned
TunableTuple.description: Require the participant to have a specific achievement, aspiration, or career.

TunableVariant.name: unlock_to_test
TunableVariant.description: The unlocked aspiration, career, achievement, or milestone want to test for.

TunableTuple.name: achievement
TunableTuple.description: This option tests for completion of a tuned Achievement.

Tunable.name: achievement
Tunable.description: The achievement we want to test.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will require that the achievement is NOT unlocked.

TunableTuple.name: aspiration
TunableTuple.description: This option tests for completion of a tuned Aspiration.

Tunable.name: aspiration
Tunable.description: The aspiration we want to test.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will require that the aspiration is NOT unlocked.

TunableTuple.name: aspiration_unlocked
TunableTuple.description: Test the actual aspiration that is being unlocked.

TunableVariant.name: check_aspiration_type
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check the aspiration type of the aspiration that was just unlocked.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The aspiration type that we are checking if it just completed.

TunableVariant.name: check_complete_only_in_sequence
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check that the aspiration that was just unlocked has a specific value of complete only in sequence set.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If complete only in sequence should be also be set or not.

TunableTuple.name: aspirations_available
TunableTuple.description: Test if there is still an aspiration that can be unlocked.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will pass if all aspirations are complete otherwise it will pass if there is a still an aspiration that can be unlocked.

TunableTuple.name: build_buy_reward_earned
TunableTuple.description: Test if a specific Build/Buy object has been unlocked.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will pass if the Build/Buy object is still locked.

Tunable.name: object_definition
Tunable.description: Tests if the specified Object Definition has been unlocked in Build/Buy. This test will NOT work for Build Buy objects that are always unlocked. It needs to have been locked before and unlocked through something like a Build Buy Object Reward.

TunableTuple.name: household_milestone_earned
TunableTuple.description: Helper class for Unlock Earned test that tests a reference to a household milestone.

Tunable.name: household_milestone
Tunable.description: The household milestone to check unlock status against.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will pass if the milestone is not complete otherwise it will pass if it's been earned.

TunableTuple.name: unlock_tracker_amount
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if a sim has unlocked a number of things from the Unlock Tracker.

TunableEnum.name: test_tag
TunableEnum.description: This test will look how many items with this tag have been unlocked.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The required number of specified things required to pass the test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: utility
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests a household's utility status. Note: This is different than testing bills, which cares if the household has paid their bills in time for a particular utility.

TunableVariant.name: household_to_test
TunableVariant.description: A variant that decides where the household to test comes from.

TunableTuple.name: active_household
TunableTuple.description: The household being controlled by the player.

TunableTuple.name: active_lot_household
TunableTuple.description: The household that owns the active lot.

Tunable.name: consider_non_household_lot
Tunable.description: If checked, when active lot has no household, we'll take utilities manager from active zone lot. Otherwise, non household lot will always fail the test.

TunableTuple.name: participant_household
TunableTuple.description: Either the participant's household if they are a Sim or the owning household if they are not.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose household is the object of this delinquency test.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableList.name: utility_states
TunableList.description: List of utilities and whether they are required to be active or not.

TunableTuple.description: Tuple containing a utility and its required active state.

Tunable.name: require_active
Tunable.description: Whether this utility is required to be active or not.

TunableEnum.name: utility
TunableEnum.description: The utility type.

TunableTuple.name: whim_completed_test
TunableTuple.description: This test checks for a specific tuned Whim Goal to have been completed, or if not specific goal is tuned here, then completing any Whim Goal will result in this test firing and resulting in a True result.

TunableVariant.name: whim_to_check
TunableVariant.description: Define them whim that is to be completed in order to pass the test.

Tunable.name: Specific_Whim
Tunable.description: This is the whim to check for matching the completed whim, resulting in passing test.

TunableTuple.name: zone
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests properties of a particular zone.

TunableVariant.name: zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Which zone we want to test.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

Tunable.name: zone_source_invalid_fallback
Tunable.description: If the zone source is invalid, specify the return value of the test. By default, if the zone source is invalid, the test will return False.

TunableTuple.name: zone_tests
TunableTuple.description: The tests we wish to run on the zone in question.

TunableVariant.name: business_tests
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test if the specified zone is a business or not.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: Test if the zone is a business, an open business, or a closed business.

TunableTuple.name: is_business
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is a business or not.

TunableTuple.name: is_business_npc_owned
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is a business owned by an npc.

Tunable.name: fail_if_not_a_business
Tunable.description: If checked, fail if the zone is not a business. If unchecked, pass if the zone is not a business.

Tunable.name: is_npc_owned
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is npc-owned. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT npc-owned.

TunableTuple.name: is_business_open
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is an open business.

TunableVariant.name: is_apartment
TunableVariant.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment. Useful in aspiration tuning, to discriminate between property types in tests of lot value. Allows 'Own a House worth X' and 'Own an Apartment worth X'

TunableTuple.name: Is_or_is_not_apartment_zone
TunableTuple.display: Is Or Is Not Apartment Zone
TunableTuple.description: Test whether the zone is an apartment or not.

Tunable.name: consider_multi_unit_an_apartment
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will consider multi unit(for residential rental) to be apartments when testing them against the apartment check.

Tunable.name: consider_penthouse_an_apartment
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will consider penthouses to be apartments when testing them against the apartment check.

Tunable.name: is_apartment
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment.

TunableVariant.name: is_penthouse
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test whether or not the current zone is a penthouse.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, the zone must be a penthouse. If unchecked, the zone cannot be a penthouse.

TunableVariant.name: is_reserved
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test if the specified zone is reserved by the zone reservation system. This usually indicates a system is using that zone in such a way that it should not be available for most other purposes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, this zone must be reserved. If not checked, it must be unreserved.

Tunable.name: use_source_venue
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will test the source venue instead of the active venue. For example, the Community Lot instead of the active Marketplace. Testing the active venue is the default.

TunableVariant.name: venue_tier
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify that the zone's venue is at the tuned tier. If 'no valid tier' is selected, this test will be True if either the current venue doesn't have tiers or if it does but it doesn't currently meet any of their requirements.

Tunable.name: tier_number
Tunable.description: The index of the tier to test. This test will return true if this tier is active and false otherwise. This should be the index of the tier in the tier list and not any player-facing index. For instance, if a tier list had a single tier, that tier would be 0, and if a second tier were added, that second tier would be 1.

TunableVariant.name: venue_type
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the zone's venue type is allowed or disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The zone's venue type must pass the whitelist and blacklist to pass the test.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

Tunable.description: Allowed and disallowed venue types.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test if the lot owner household for the specified zone was changed between when the zone was saved and when it was loaded.

Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone's owner household was changed between when the zone was saved and when it was loaded. If unchecked, test will pass if the zone's owner household was NOT changed between when the zone was saved and when it was loaded.

TunableVariant.name: exclude_vfx_mask
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, when this trait is added to a Sim, the mask will be applied, making VFX invisible that are also tagged with this flag.

TunableList.name: apply_exclude_vfx_mask
TunableList.description: The Exclude VFX Mask that will be applied.

Tunable.description: List of moods that are prevented by having this trait.

TunableList.name: genders
TunableList.description: The allowed genders for this trait. If no genders are specified, then all genders are considered valid.

Tunable.name: hide_relationships
Tunable.description: If checked, then any relationships with a Sim who has this trait will not be displayed in the UI. This is done by keeping the relationship from having any tracks to actually track which keeps it out of the UI.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: The trait's icon.

TunableList.name: initial_commodities
TunableList.description: A list of commodities that will be added to a sim on load, if the sim has this trait. Visible commodities are displayed in the motive panel. Use Initial Non Motive Commodities to add a visible commodity that isn't displayed in the motive panel. If a given commodity is also blacklisted by another trait that the sim also has, it will NOT be added. Example: Adult Age Trait adds Hunger. Vampire Trait blacklists Hunger. Hunger will not be added.

TunableList.name: initial_commodities_blacklist
TunableList.description: A list of commodities that will be prevented from being added to a sim that has this trait. This always takes priority over any commodities listed in any trait's Initial Commodities and Initial Non Motive Commodities. Example: Adult Age Trait adds Hunger. Vampire Trait blacklists Hunger. Hunger will not be added.

TunableList.name: initial_non_motive_commodities
TunableList.description: A list of commodities that will be added to a sim on load, if the sim has this trait. Visible commodities are provided to the UI, but won't appear in the motive panel. These commodities are expected to have custom UI added. If a given commodity is also blacklisted by another trait that the sim also has, it will NOT be added. Example: Adult Age Trait adds Hunger. Vampire Trait blacklists Hunger. Hunger will not be added.

TunableVariant.name: interactions
TunableVariant.description: Mixer interactions that are available to Sims equipped with this trait.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: This is where you tune any sub actions of this interaction. The interactions here can be tuned as reference to individual affordances, lists of affordances, or phase affordances. Sub actions are affordances that can be run anytime this interaction is active. Autonomy will choose which interaction runs. Using phase affordances you can also tune Quick Time or optional affordances that can appear.

Tunable.description: Linked Affordance
A reference to a AffordanceList tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: is_npc_only
Tunable.description: If checked, this trait will get removed from Sims that have a home when the zone is loaded or whenever they switch to a household that has a home zone.

TunableVariant.name: listen_animation_overrides
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this tunable will provide listen animation overrides for this trait.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tunables that define which listen animation overrides should be applied.

TunableTuple.name: default_override
TunableTuple.description: The default listen animation override. This should only be applied if the override map is not defined, or if the interaction in question is not in the override map.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

Tunable.name: balloon_chance
Tunable.description: The chance that the balloon will play.

TunableList.name: balloon_choices
TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

TunableTuple.name: balloon_icon
TunableTuple.description: The tuning for the actual balloon icon.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, Back, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the 'props' field, the data inside 'props' will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override. If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableVariant.name: reactionlet
TunableVariant.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.
