TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, Back, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the 'props' field, the data inside 'props' will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite. If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override. If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

TunableVariant.name: object_by_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, select the object based on a participant type.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableVariant.name: object_by_tests
TunableVariant.description: If set we will override the definition reference with the definition that passes the tests. If none of them passes we take de definition by default.

TunableTuple.description: A set of tests that need to pass for the definition to have the tuned preference.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that need to pass for the Sim to have the tuned preference.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_object_based_on_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define a relationship between the participant and a replacement prop. We use this during proposals to swap the ring prop from the picker object (a ring on a stand) to tuned object (a ring without the stand). This tuning will be ignored if object_by_participant already tuned.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the participant and give a list of objects and the replacement prop each one of the objects relates to.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableList.name: prop_replacement_map
TunableList.description: A mapping of participant object to the new replacement prop.

Tunable.name: participant_object
Tunable.description: The object that we want to replace

Tunable.name: replacement_object
Tunable.description: The object that replaces and will appear in the animation

Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: from_participant
TunableVariant.description: The participant to copy the state over

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant type that will be used to get the participant that will provide the override value.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableList.description: Required slot overrides

TunableList.description: The sound overrides.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_sound
TunableVariant.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: play_sound
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

TunableList.name: vfx
TunableList.description: VFX overrides for this animation. The key is the effect's actor name. Please note, this is not the name of the vfx that would normally play. This is the name of the actor in the ASM that is associated to a specific effect.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description: Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty. For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the 'props' field, the data inside 'props' will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite. If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override. If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

TunableVariant.name: object_by_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, select the object based on a participant type.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableVariant.name: object_by_tests
TunableVariant.description: If set we will override the definition reference with the definition that passes the tests. If none of them passes we take de definition by default.

TunableTuple.description: A set of tests that need to pass for the definition to have the tuned preference.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that need to pass for the Sim to have the tuned preference.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_object_based_on_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define a relationship between the participant and a replacement prop. We use this during proposals to swap the ring prop from the picker object (a ring on a stand) to tuned object (a ring without the stand). This tuning will be ignored if object_by_participant already tuned.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the participant and give a list of objects and the replacement prop each one of the objects relates to.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableList.name: prop_replacement_map
TunableList.description: A mapping of participant object to the new replacement prop.

Tunable.name: participant_object
Tunable.description: The object that we want to replace

Tunable.name: replacement_object
Tunable.description: The object that replaces and will appear in the animation

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.name: from_actor
Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: from_participant
TunableVariant.description: The participant to copy the state over

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant type that will be used to get the participant that will provide the override value.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableVariant.name: reactionlet
TunableVariant.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: There is an arbitrary number of possible animation selectors, based on participation in group.

TunableList.name: groups
TunableList.description: A list of difficulty to animation mappings.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description: Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty. For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, Back, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the 'props' field, the data inside 'props' will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite. If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override. If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

TunableVariant.name: object_by_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, select the object based on a participant type.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableVariant.description: If set we will override the definition reference with the definition that passes the tests. If none of them passes we take de definition by default.

TunableTuple.description: A set of tests that need to pass for the definition to have the tuned preference.

Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that need to pass for the Sim to have the tuned preference.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define a relationship between the participant and a replacement prop. We use this during proposals to swap the ring prop from the picker object (a ring on a stand) to tuned object (a ring without the stand). This tuning will be ignored if object_by_participant already tuned.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the participant and give a list of objects and the replacement prop each one of the objects relates to.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableList.name: prop_replacement_map
TunableList.description: A mapping of participant object to the new replacement prop.

Tunable.description: The object that we want to replace

Tunable.description: The object that replaces and will appear in the animation

Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.description: The participant to copy the state over

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant type that will be used to get the participant that will provide the override value.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableList.description: Required slot overrides

TunableList.description: The sound overrides.

TunableVariant.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: play_sound
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

TunableList.name: vfx
TunableList.description: VFX overrides for this animation. The key is the effect's actor name. Please note, this is not the name of the vfx that would normally play. This is the name of the actor in the ASM that is associated to a specific effect.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description: Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty. For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, Back, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values

TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override. If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableList.name: balloon_target
TunableList.description: Who to play balloons over relative to the interaction. Generally, balloon tuning will use either balloon_animation_target or balloon_target.

TunableVariant.name: balloon_view_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Vector3 offset from the balloon bone to the thought balloon.

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, Back, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the 'props' field, the data inside 'props' will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite. If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override. If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

TunableVariant.name: object_by_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, select the object based on a participant type.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableVariant.name: object_by_tests
TunableVariant.description: If set we will override the definition reference with the definition that passes the tests. If none of them passes we take de definition by default.

TunableTuple.description: A set of tests that need to pass for the definition to have the tuned preference.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that need to pass for the Sim to have the tuned preference.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_object_based_on_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define a relationship between the participant and a replacement prop. We use this during proposals to swap the ring prop from the picker object (a ring on a stand) to tuned object (a ring without the stand). This tuning will be ignored if object_by_participant already tuned.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the participant and give a list of objects and the replacement prop each one of the objects relates to.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: ParticipantType used to get the object.

TunableList.name: prop_replacement_map
TunableList.description: A mapping of participant object to the new replacement prop.

Tunable.name: participant_object
Tunable.description: The object that we want to replace

Tunable.name: replacement_object
Tunable.description: The object that replaces and will appear in the animation

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.name: from_actor
Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: from_participant
TunableVariant.description: The participant to copy the state over

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant type that will be used to get the participant that will provide the override value.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableList.name: required_slots
TunableList.description: Required slot overrides

TunableList.name: sounds
TunableList.description: The sound overrides.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_sound
TunableVariant.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: play_sound
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

TunableList.name: vfx
TunableList.description: VFX overrides for this animation. The key is the effect's actor name. Please note, this is not the name of the vfx that would normally play. This is the name of the actor in the ASM that is associated to a specific effect.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description: Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty. For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

TunableVariant.name: axis

TunableVariant.name: reincarnation_carry_over_traits
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, sim's who are reincarnated will have these traits added to them.

TunableList.description: A list of fixup actions which will be performed on a sim_info with this trait when it is loaded.

TunableTuple.name: career_fixup_action
TunableTuple.description: A fix up action to set a career with a specific level.

TunableList.name: skill_fixup_actions

TunableTuple.description: A fix up action to grant perks to a Sim. It checks perk required unlock tuning and unlocks prerequisite perks first.

Tunable.name: number_of_perks_to_grant
Tunable.description: The number of perks that should be granted to the Sim. This is limited to a maximum now since we might have performance issue otherwise.

TunableList.name: potential_perks_to_grant

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that must pass for this action to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: skill_fixup_action
TunableTuple.description: A fix up action to set a skill with a specific level.

TunableEnum.name: sim_info_fixup_actions_timing
TunableEnum.description: This is DEPRECATED, don't tune this field. We usually don't do trait-based fixup unless it's related to CAS stories. We keep this field only for legacy support reason. This is mostly to optimize performance when applying fix-ups to a Sim. We ideally would not like to spend time scanning every Sim on every load to see if they need fixups. Please be sure you consult a GPE whenever you are creating fixup tuning.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The allowed species for this trait. If not species are specified, then all species are considered valid.

TunableList.name: super_affordances
TunableList.description: Super affordances this adds to the object.

TunableList.description: Super affordances this adds to the target.

TunableTuple.description: Tunables related to a specific affordance we are providing, with the ability to override specifics about targets, restrictions, and dependencies.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: An affordance we make available. Pay attention to who this affordance is provided on. See the provided affordances description for more info.

Tunable.name: allow_self
Tunable.description: If set, the Sim running the providing interaction is allowed to also run the provided interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_filter
TunableVariant.description: Define the type of objects this affordance is provided on.

TunableTuple.name: allow_all

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_portal_flags
TunableTuple.description: Specify portal requirements for the object.

TunableList.name: portal_flags
TunableList.description: The object must have any of these portal flags in order to satisfy the requirement.

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_sim
TunableTuple.description: Specify Sim or non-Sim requirements for the object.

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_state
TunableTuple.description: Specify state requirements for the object.

TunableTuple.name: states
TunableTuple.description: The required states to pass this test.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_tags
TunableTuple.description: Specify tag requirements for the object.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The object must have any of these tags in order to satisfy the requirement.

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_terrain
TunableTuple.description: Specify a requirement of the object being the terrain.

Tunable.name: allow_unroutable_terrain
Tunable.description: Allow surfaces that are in unroutable terrain. For example, when clicking on a neighboring lot.

TunableList.name: disallowed_surfaces
TunableList.description: Routing surfaces where the placement of this object should fail.

Tunable.name: teleport_style_interaction_to_inject
Tunable.description: When this trait is added to a Sim, if a teleport style interaction is specified, any time another interaction runs, we may run this teleport style interaction to shorten or replace the route to the target.

Tunable.name: thumbnail_type_asm_param
Tunable.description: If enabled the ASM param 'ThumbnailType' will be given the same value as trait_asm_param

TunableTuple.name: trait_asm_overrides
TunableTuple.description: Tunables that will specify if a Trait will add any parameters to the Sim and how it will affect their boundary conditions.

Tunable.name: consider_for_boundary_conditions
Tunable.description: If enabled the trait_asm_param will be considered when a Sim is building the goals and validating against its boundary conditions. This should ONLY be enabled, if we need this parameter for cases like a posture transition, or boundary specific cases. On regular cases like an animation outcome, this is not needed. i.e. Vampire trait has an isVampire parameter set to True, so when animatin out of the coffin it does different get in/out animations. When this is enabled, isVampire will be set to False for every other Sim.

TunableVariant.name: param_type
TunableVariant.description: Define if this trait is parameterized as an on/off value or as part of an enumeration.

Tunable.name: enum
Tunable.description: The name of the parameter enumeration. For example, if this value is tailType, then the tailType actor parameter is set to the value specified in param_value, for this Sim.

Tunable.name: trait_asm_param
Tunable.description: The ASM parameter for this trait. If unset, it will be auto- generated depending on the instance name (e.g. 'trait_Clumsy').

Tunable.name: trait_description
Tunable.description: The trait's description.

Tunable.name: trait_origin_description
Tunable.description: A description of how the Sim obtained this trait. Can be overloaded for other uses in certain cases: - When the trait type is AGENT this string is the name of the agency's Trade type and will be provided with the owning sim as its token. - When the trait type is HIDDEN and the trait is used by the CAS STORIES flow, this can be used as a secondary description in the CAS Stories UI. If this trait is tagged as a CAREER CAS stories trait, this description will be used to explain which skills are also granted with this career.

TunableEnum.name: trait_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of the trait.

TunableVariant.name: ui_category
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then this trait will be displayed in a specific category within the relationship panel/Sim Profile if this trait would be displayed within that panel.

TunableEnum.name: ui_trait_category_tag
TunableEnum.description: The UI trait category that we use to categorize this trait within the relationship panel/Sim Profile.

TunableVariant.name: ui_commodity_sort_override
TunableVariant.description: Optional list of commodities to override the default UI sort order.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: The position of the commodity in this list represents the sort order. Add all possible combination of traits in the list. If we have two traits which have sort override, we will implement a priority system to determine which determines which trait sort order to use.

TunableVariant.name: vfx_mask
TunableVariant.description: If enabled when this trait is added the masks will be applied to the Sim affecting the visibility of specific VFX. Example: TRAIT_CHILDREN will provide a mask MASK_CHILDREN which the monster battle object will only display VFX for any Sim using that mask.

TunableList.name: apply_vfx_mask
TunableList.description: Mask that will be added to the Sim's mask when the trait is added.

TunableVariant.name: voice_effect
TunableVariant.description: The voice effect of a Sim with this trait. This is prioritized against other traits with voice effects. The Sim may only have one voice effect at a time.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A voice effect request. This modifies the Sim's voice effect if it's the request with the highest priority among all requests.

TunableEnum.name: priority
TunableEnum.description: The requests priority.

Tunable.name: voice_effect
Tunable.description: When set, this voice effect will be applied to the Sim when the trait is added and removed when the trait is removed.

TunableVariant.name: whim_set
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then this trait will offer a whim set to the Sim when it is active.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A whim set that is active when this trait is active.
